adx_keywords: Murders, Attempted Murders and Homicides;Antifa Movement (US);George Floyd Protests (2020);Black Lives Matter Movement;Police Brutality, Misconduct and Shootings;Right-Wing Extremism and Alt-Right;Reinoehl, Michael (1972-2020);Danielson, Aaron J (d 2020);Patriot Prayer;Portland (Ore)
byline: By Hallie Golden, Mike Baker and Adam Goldman
title: Suspect in Fatal Portland Shooting Is Killed by Officers During Arrest
abstract: Law enforcement agents killed Michael Forest Reinoehl while trying to arrest him, four officials said. He was being investigated in the fatal shooting of a supporter of a far-right group.

media.caption: Michael Reinoehl was killed by a federally led fugitive task force in Lacey, Wash., on Thursday. He was being investigated in a fatal shooting at a Portland protest.
media.copyright: Joshua Bessex for The New York Times

adx_keywords: Deaths (Obituaries);Movies;Actors and Actresses;Black People;Boseman, Chadwick
byline: By Reggie Ugwu and Michael Levenson
title: ‘Black Panther’ Star Chadwick Boseman Dies of Cancer at 43
abstract: The actor also played groundbreaking figures like James Brown, Jackie Robinson and Thurgood Marshall, becoming one of his generation’s most sought-after leading men.

media.caption: The actor Chadwick Boseman in 2018. He was 35 when he appeared in his first prominent role, as Jackie Robinson.
media.copyright: Axel Koester for The New York Times

adx_keywords: George Floyd Protests (2020);Demonstrations, Protests and Riots;Patriot Prayer;Portland (Ore);Oregon
title: One Person Dead in Portland After Clashes Between Trump Supporters and Protesters
abstract: A man affiliated with a right-wing group was shot and killed Saturday night. A caravan of supporters of President Trump had driven into downtown Portland.

media.caption: I can’t get in to edit the digital column, Should be: Police officers guard the area where a man was shot and killed during unrest Saturday night in Portland, Ore.
media.copyright: Mason Trinca for The New York Times

adx_keywords: Coronavirus (2019-nCoV);Tests (Medical);Contact Tracing (Public Health);Laboratories and Scientific Equipment;your-feed-healthcare;Centers for Disease Control and Prevention;Food and Drug Administration
title: Your Coronavirus Test Is Positive. Maybe It Shouldn’t Be.
abstract: The usual diagnostic tests may simply be too sensitive and too slow to contain the spread of the virus.
org_facet: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention

media.caption: Tests authorized by the F.D.A. provide only a yes-no answer to infection, and will identify as positive patients with low amounts of virus in their bodies.
media.copyright: Johnny Milano for The New York Times

title: N.Y.C. Tenants Say They Were Tricked Into Appearing in R.N.C. Video
abstract: “I am not a Trump supporter,” one of the tenants said, adding that she was furious that her interview with a government official was used for the convention.

media.caption: Claudia Perez, left, and Carmen Quiñones appeared in a video that was aired Thursday at the Republican National Convention.

adx_keywords: Police Brutality, Misconduct and Shootings;Black People;Demonstrations, Protests and Riots;Prude, Daniel (d 2020);Rochester (NY)
byline: By Sarah Maslin Nir, Michael Wilson, Troy Closson and Jesse McKinley
title: 7 Police Officers Suspended as a Black Man’s Suffocation Roils Rochester
abstract: Daniel Prude, who was having a psychotic episode, died after police officers placed a mesh hood over his head in March.

media.caption: Protesters gathered at the site where Daniel Prude was fatally injured as the Rochester police tried to detain him in March. It was not until Wednesday that gruesome video of the encounter was made public.
media.copyright: Joshua Rashaad McFadden for The New York Times

title: Tracking the Suspect in the Fatal Kenosha Shootings
abstract: Footage appears to show a teenager shooting three people during protests in Wisconsin. We tracked his movements that night.

adx_keywords: Rescues;Maritime Accidents and Safety;Ferries;Children and Childhood;Antirrio (Greece);Greece
title: 3-Year-Old Clinging to Unicorn Float Is Rescued From Sea in Greece
abstract: The dramatic rescue of a child who drifted out to sea on a toy flotation device, captured on video, earned the praise of the Greek prime minister.

adx_keywords: Real Estate and Housing (Residential);Suburbs;Economic Conditions and Trends;New York Metropolitan Area;New York City
title: New Yorkers Are Fleeing to the Suburbs: ‘The Demand Is Insane’
abstract: The pandemic is spurring home sales as prosperous city residents seek more space. One listing had 97 showings and received 24 offers.

media.caption: A queue for an open house in Belleville, a New Jersey township west of Manhattan, on a recent Sunday. Buyers have expressed worries about the health risks of crowded urban neighborhoods.
media.copyright: Karsten Moran for The New York Times

adx_keywords: Black People;Murders, Attempted Murders and Homicides;Flowers, Curtis;Evans, Doug (Attorney);Supreme Court (US);Mississippi
title: After 6 Murder Trials and Nearly 24 Years, Charges Dropped Against Curtis Flowers
abstract: Mr. Flowers had faced the possibility of a seventh trial in the quadruple-murder case from Mississippi.

media.caption: Curtis Flowers, center, as he exited the Winston-Choctaw Regional Correctional Facility in Louisville, Miss., in 2019.

byline: By Sheila Kaplan, Katherine J. Wu and Katie Thomas
title: C.D.C. Tells States How to Prepare for Covid-19 Vaccine by Early November
abstract: As President Trump pushes the possibility of a vaccine this year, the C.D.C. has outlined technical scenarios to state public health officials for an unidentified Vaccine A and Vaccine B.

byline: By Patrick Kingsley and José Bautista
title: ‘Here We Go Again’: A Second Virus Wave Grips Spain
abstract: The coronavirus is spreading much faster in Spain than anywhere else in Europe. After a relative lull during the summer, experts fear it signals a new surge across the continent.

media.caption: A suspected Covid-19 patient arriving at the emergency room of a hospital  in Málaga, Spain, on Sunday.
media.copyright: Samuel Aranda for The New York Times

adx_keywords: Coronavirus Reopenings;Education (K-12);Spain
title: El país donde las discotecas son más importantes que las escuelas
abstract: España necesita una revolución educativa que ponga la educación entre sus principales prioridades. Los políticos han demostrado durante la pandemia que está entre las últimas.

media.caption: Estudiantes en un aula de la Universidad de Girona se preparan para hacer sus exámenes de admisión en julio.

byline: By Michael Schwirtz and Melissa Eddy
title: Aleksei Navalny Was Poisoned With Novichok, Germany Says
abstract: The German government said that toxicology tests showed the Russian opposition leader was poisoned with a nerve agent from the same class used in a 2018 attack in Britain on an ex-Soviet spy.

adx_keywords: Books and Literature;First Ladies (US);United States Politics and Government;Winston Wolkoff, Stephanie;Trump, Melania
title: 7 Takeaways From ‘Melania and Me,’ by the First Lady’s Former Friend
abstract: Stephanie Winston Wolkoff was part of the Trumps’ inner circle — until she wasn’t. Her memoir is a cautionary tale.

media.caption: Stephanie Winston Wolkoff writes: “Yes, Operation Block Ivanka was petty. Melania was in on this mission. But in our minds, Ivanka shouldn’t have made herself the center of attention in her father’s inauguration.”

adx_keywords: Coronavirus Reopenings;Education (K-12);Coronavirus (2019-nCoV);Quarantines;Coronavirus Risks and Safety Concerns;United States
title: When It Comes to Covid-19, Most of Us Have Risk Exactly Backward
abstract: We aren’t very good at discussing trade-offs, but we need to make some during this pandemic.

adx_keywords: Aviation Accidents, Safety and Disasters;Airlines and Airplanes;Jetpacks;Federal Aviation Administration;Federal Bureau of Investigation;Los Angeles (Calif)
title: Jetpack Sighting at 3,000 Feet Over Los Angeles Prompts Investigation
abstract: Two commercial pilots approaching the city’s main airport reported a man out for a high-altitude spin. The F.B.I. is looking into it.

media.caption: “We just passed a guy in a jetpack,” an American Airlines pilot said as he approached Los Angeles International Airport on Sunday.

title: Prince Harry and Meghan Sign Megawatt Netflix Deal
abstract: Six months after ceasing to be working members of the British royal family, the Duke and Duchess of Sussex are Hollywood producers.

media.caption: The next chapter in the saga of Prince Harry and Meghan, Duchess of Sussex, will take place largely in the entertainment business.

title: What to Know About Colon Cancer
abstract: The cancer that killed Chadwick Boseman is the second-leading cause of cancer deaths in the United States, and rates are rising among younger people.

media.caption: Chadwick Boseman at the Black Panther premiere in Los Angeles in 2018. The actor passed away this week of colon cancer.

title: What if Facebook Is the Real ‘Silent Majority’?
abstract: Right-wing influencers are dominating the political discussion on Facebook, raising questions about whether it will translate into electoral success in November.
